inclusion.criterion: Assignment: Consecutive patients diagnosed to have acute overt HE will be randomized into two groups (group A and B) using sealed opaque envelopes containing computer-generated random numbers.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Masking: Sequentially numbered boxes containing identical LOLA or placebo ampoules, according to the allocation sequence will ensure allocation concealment.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Randomization implementation: Enrollment of patients, assessing eligibility and obtaining informed consent will be carried out by one of the investigators (S.S. Sidhu or O. Goyal, BC Sharma)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Study Intervention: The patients will be randomized to receive either placebo or LOLA at dose of 30 grams daily, by intravenous infusion over 24 hours.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Laboratory tests: Biochemical tests: Hemogram, blood glucose, liver function tests, prothrombin time, serum electrolytes, blood urea and serum creatinine will be done at baseline, and at 2nd and 5th day of treatment, or earlier if indicated.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Microbiologic tests: A diagnostic paracentesis will be done in all patients with ascites, at baseline, to diagnose Spontaneous Bacterial Peritonitis.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Ammonia estimation: Fasting venous ammonia levels will be estimated by using the blood ammonia meter (PocketChem BA) at baseline and then daily for the next 5 days.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Wilson's disease as the etiological factor of liver disease
exclusion.label: triggers
